summary: This document is a sign-in log and training presentation for a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) staff training course titled 'Suicide Prevention/SHU Training' held on December 7, 2018. The presentation outlines suicide prevention protocols, risk factors for inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU), and management strategies for high-risk groups including mentally ill, behavior disordered, sex offender, and protective custody inmates.

events.title: Suicide Prevention/SHU Training
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons training course for staff on suicide prevention protocols and management of high-risk inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU).

keyFacts: The document is a BOP training presentation and sign-in log for a 'Suicide Prevention/SHU Training' course dated December 7, 2018.
Training material states that 30-80% of inmate suicides in the BOP occur on locked units like SHUs, and single cells in these units are especially risky.
High-risk inmate groups identified include the mentally ill, behavior disordered inmates, and sex offender and protective custody inmates.
The training advises double-celling SHU inmates to reduce isolation and suicide risk, and outlines specific management strategies like Suicide Risk Management Plans.
The document is marked 'SENSITIVE - LIMITED OFFICIAL USE' and includes a participant sign-in log with fields for names and signatures, though no specific individuals are named in the provided text.
